channel.title: Why doesn't my command work? [317 Delta]

item.title: Why doesn't my command work? [317 Delta]
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Sanskrit:

-1 does not mean the same thing as no task, because the integer for no task would be 0. You either have 1 task, or 0 tasks, no other number.

The integer for no task is -1. The Task ID is the ID of the npc you were assigned to kill. The amount is how many.

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't my command work? [317 Delta]

-1 does not mean the same thing as no task, because the integer for no task would be 0. You either have 1 task, or 0 tasks, no other number.

item.title: Why doesn't my command work? [317 Delta]
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Sanskrit, post:4, topic:367989”]taskAmount = -1;
that means the variable “taskAmount” is assigned to the value of -1.
it should look something like:

(taskAmount) -1;

It also depends upon where your server is grabbing the variable data from, so you will have to add that as well.[/quote]

Which is what I want. Having the Task ID and amount at -1 means the player has no task.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't my command work? [317 Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

taskAmount = -1;

that means the variable “taskAmount” is assigned to the value of -1.
it should look something like:

(taskAmount) -1;

It also depends upon where your server is grabbing the variable data from, so you will have to add that as well.

item.title: Why doesn't my command work? [317 Delta]
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Well I just added a ::resettask command to reset your slayer task, but it doesn’t work for some reason. Here’s the code:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("resettask")) {
taskID = -1;
taskAmount = -1;
sM("Your slayer task has been reset.");
}

Help would be appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't my command work? [317 Delta]
